stimulusHtml: Based on the diagram, which of the following processes most likely caused the bottom-dwelling plants in the lake to die?

features.html: The diagram below depicts a surface water source that has undergone cultural eutrophication.

choicesHtml: The remnants of the corn crop were burned after the corn was harvested, decreasing the amount of dissolved oxygen in the water.
Toxins such as lead and mercury were released into the water when the fish died.
The algal bloom prevented sunlight from reaching the bottom-dwelling plants, which reduced the rates of photosynthesis.
Oxygen was released into the water when the algae died.
